page.title: 05FARMING IN CUMNOCK
page.content:
The farms in the Cumnock area are mostly dairy farms. The biggest farm in the Cumnock district is Changue Farm which belongs to the Stevenson family.
They produce milk and sell it to the local shops and round the houses. The cattle are mainly Fresian and Ayrshire. A good dairy cow produces 5 gallons of milk per day. The cattle are grazed on managed pasture land which covers most of this area . In winter the cows are kept on silage also turnips and potatoes. The cows are kept indoors in the winter but are let out in the summer to graze. The cattle are milked twice a day about 6 am then again about 3 pm.
